Amynthas hohuanmontis Tsai et al ., 2002 : 758
. Mt. Hohuan, Nantou County; -
Tsai et al ., 2004 a
: 6
; -
Blakemore et al ., 2006
: 228
.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remarks:
A. hohuanmontis
was originally described as an athecate earthworm (Tsai et al . 2002 ). However, examination of specimens from successive collections showed that this species has spermathecae from three pairs in VI-VIII to absence, and the structure of the prostate glands varies from normal, asymmetrical, to absence, which also indicates parthenogenetic degeneration.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remarks:
A. minimus
was first collected by
Kobayashi ( 1940 b
, c ). Recently, it was also collected by us from the No. 100 Forest Road (elevation 1060 m ), Ilan County on
17 October 2002
and Hushan Temple (elevation 140 m ), Douliou, Yunlin County on
12 June 2007
.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Amynthas omeimontis polyglandular
- Chen et al ., 2002 : 77 . Fushan Botanical Garden, Ilan County; - Chuang et al ., 2002 : 68 . Taipei, Taoyuan and Ilan counties.

Remarks:
A. polyglandularis
is considered as
A. o. polyglandularis
, a subspecies of
Amynthas omeimontis (
Chen, 1931
)
by
Sims and Easton ( 1972 )
. However, the arrangement of its genital papillae differs distinctively from that of
A. omeimontis
, sufficient for specific distinction (
Tsai et al . 2000 a
). Also,
A. polyglandularis
has simple intestinal caeca whereas
A. omeimontis
has finger-like caeca (
Blakemore et al . 2006
).

bibRefCitation.author: Tsai
bibRefCitation.refString: Tsai, C. F., Shen, H. P. & Tsai, S. C. (2001) Some new earthworms of the genus Amynthas (Oligochaeta: Megascolecidae) from Mt. Hohuan of Taiwan. Zoological Studies, 40 (4), 276 - 288.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Amynthas proasacceus Tsai et al ., 2001 : 282
. Mt. Hohuan between Hualien and Nantou counties and Rueyen Creek Nature Reserve, Nantou County; -
Tsai et al ., 2004 a
: 6
.

Amynthas assacceus
-
Blakemore et al ., 2006
: 228
.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remarks:
A. proasacceus
of Taiwan is considered to be an uncertain synonym of
A. asacceus (
Chen, 1938
)
of Hainan Island, China , and the latter is the athecate morph of the former (
Blakemore 2003
;
Blakemore et al . 2006
). Both species share fairly similar characteristics in size, large round male porophores, and degenerated spermathecae and male reproductive organs, but they are specifically distinguishable.
A. asacceus
has a single seta between the porophores, long coiled prostatic ducts, and male pores, each in a dark-coloured, glandular patch which is 0.7 mm in diameter, (
Chen 1938
).
A. proasacceus
has 6-9 setae between the porophores, short C-shaped prostatic ducts, and male pores, each in a smooth, indistinctly coloured male patch which is 0.45-0.65 mm in diameter and surrounded by two or three circular folds, (Tsai et al . 2001 ). Furthermore, recent molecular evidence based on COI sequence analysis demonstrates that
A. proasacceus
and
A. asacceus
are two valid species (
Chang et al . 2007 a
).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Amynthas masatakae (Beddard, 1892 )
- Chuang & Chen, 2002 : 74 . Mt. Dongyan, Taoyuan County.

Remarks:
A. lautus
is synonymous to
A. robustus
according to the recent molecular analysis (
Chang et al . 2007 a
).
A. masatakae
is also synonymous to
A. robustus
according to
Easton ( 1981 )
,
Blakemore ( 2003 )
and
Blakemore et al . ( 2006 )
.
